image.altText: Hand holding money, notes and coins with a coffee cup and fruit in the background, cost of living

props.synopsis: Two federal ombudsmen have joined forces to launch a scathing review of the Australian Tax Office and call on government agencies to act more fairly when they chase people for debts.

title.children: 'It tips people over the edge': ATO criticised for resurrecting old tax debts

image.altText: A drone hovers while a green laser appears pointed at it.

props.synopsis: Defence has for the first time awarded a multi-million-dollar contract to a Melbourne company to trial its "directed energy" technology as a way of combating unmanned aerial vehicles.

title.children: Defence to trial drone-killing lasers which use advanced 'directed energy' technology

image.altText: IMAGE MAIN 25 Mar

props.synopsis: The NSW housing minister says she's asked the federal government to double its multi-billion-dollar spend in housing to accelerate home construction.

title.children: NSW demands federal government doubles funding for housing

image.altText: Rebecca White and Dean Winter composite image.

props.synopsis: After Tasmanian Labor's four straight election losses, three of them led by Rebecca White, the push is on to install a new leader.

title.children: Move on to oust Rebecca White as Tasmanian Labor leader

image.altText: Seven politicians in a collage.

props.synopsis: A private investigator and a former mayor of the Royal Borough of Windsor are among the Jacqui Lambie candidates in the running to hold the balance of power in Tasmania.

title.children: A private investigator, a former British mayor – meet Tasmania's possible new crossbench

image.altText: Donald Trump's face pictured against a backdrop of red and white horizonal stripes

props.synopsis: Donald Trump owes an enormous sum of money to the state of New York and he is running out of time to hand it over. This is what we know about the case against Trump and his battle to pay his big bill.

title.children: Trump has asked 30 different companies for a $712m loan. Here’s why he needs it by tonight

image.altText: A tall, gold-tinged building towers over a vintage-style clock on a public street in New York.

props.synopsis: Mr Trump is facing an imminent deadline to post a bond of $US454 million as he looks to appeal a ruling he fraudulently overstated the value of his assets — or New York's attorney-general could begin confiscating his properties.

title.children: How wealthy is Donald Trump exactly? Here's a look at his companies, properties and income

image.altText: A man sitting in a wheelchair next to his service dog on an airport tarmac

props.synopsis: An Adelaide disability advocate says he felt "embarrassed" and "shocked" during a trip to the Gold Coast with Virgin Australia.

title.children: 'The cabin manager rolled their eyes': Virgin Australia apologises to disability advocate

image.altText: A small green parrot on a gum tree branch.

props.synopsis: While a new method of counting has resulted in the estimates of an endangered bird species being revised upwards, researchers say it in no way means the threat of extinction has lessened for the swift parrot.

title.children: Swift parrots still in peril, despite revised numbers of surviving birds due to new counting method

image.altText: Composite of a man in black and white with a shipping yard photo behind him.

props.synopsis: The Melbourne-based chapter of the 'Ndrangheta may be using "fake news" to try and divert law enforcement away from its leadership, an Italian organised crime expert has said.

title.children: The Calabrian mafia may be using 'fake news' but the killing of a Melbourne man is likely a message sent

image.altText: Irma Palasics

props.synopsis: A man charged over the 1999 killing of Canberra woman Irma Palasics during a violent home invasion is committed to stand trial in the ACT as police say they identified him from DNA left on a milk bottle.

title.children: Man accused of cold case murder of ACT grandmother identified by DNA on milk bottle, police say

image.altText: building made from snow

props.synopsis: When a 15-metre-high snow sculpture took centre stage at a snow festival in Japan, it helped form a surprisingly powerful relationship between two islands — Hokkaido and Tasmania.

title.children: In the 1980s, Tasmania's Government House was sculpted in snow in Japan. Here's why

image.altText: Princess Catherine wearing a blue coat holds her daughters hand next to William and sons George and Louis

props.synopsis: After his office initially failed to execute a viable PR plan to protect his family, Prince William may now have time and space to focus on his wife's health and the wellbeing of his children. But the heir to the British throne has a rocky road ahead.

title.children: Caring for his wife, stepping in for his father and estranged from his brother, William goes it alone

image.altText: photo of building with blue sky background

props.synopsis: Two girls, aged 13 and 14 at the time of their arrest, faced court for sentencing today after pleading guilty to charges including torture, deprivation of liberty, and attempting to pervert justice.

title.children: Teen girl 'feels really bad' for torturing 13-year-old in incident that went viral on TikTok

image.altText: A family stand and smile for a photo

props.synopsis: Daniel Stuart's family was still clinging to hope he was alive after receiving a dreaded call from police, until they saw online footage of his truck engulfed in flames.

title.children: 'Blow on top of blow' for family of truck driver killed in triple-fatal crash at Maryborough

image.altText: An aurora glows over a calm body of water.

props.synopsis: A camera is often required to get a glimpse of the southern lights, but the display this weekend was so powerful it could be seen with the naked eye.

title.children: 'Phenomenal' aurora australis thrills observers across southern coastline

image.altText: A shirtless black man sits in a barrel at night while two south-east Asian men stand aggressively over him.

props.synopsis: A series of videos described as "barbaric" have circulated online, showing what appear to be soldiers punching, kicking and slicing a Papuan man in a barrel.

title.children: Top general apologises for 'barbaric' torture video as 13 soldiers detained amid ongoing probe

image.altText: A man wearing a dark-coloured button-up shirt and blazer with sunglasses in the city with people in the background.

props.synopsis: Veteran Heston Russell was accused of assaulting a man at a Woolloomooloo party in January 2022. Magistrate Margaret Quinn ruled in his favour, saying there were inconsistencies in witness accounts.

title.children: 'The law was not broken': Heston Russell cleared of assault accusation at Sydney party

image.altText: A composite image of two men, whose faces are slightly in shadow. They are each looking to the side with serious expressions.

props.synopsis: Military lawyer David McBride gave journalist Dan Oakes more than a hundred classified military documents. Both are still living with the consequences.

title.children: He gave this journalist classified military documents. Both still live with the consequences

image.altText: Quake 1

props.synopsis: The magnitude-6.9 earthquake has shaken villages along the Sepik River which were already battling a flood disaster.

title.children: PNG earthquake destroys 1,000 homes and reportedly kills three people

image.altText: A tiny baby lying on a hosptal bed. Blue gloved hands hold an oxygen mask to their face.

props.synopsis: RSV is a highly contagious virus that attacks the lungs and can lead to respiratory illnesses including bronchiolitis and pneumonia. It is the leading cause of hospitalisation for infants in the state.

title.children: This virus lands more babies and young children in hospital than any other condition, and now there's a free jab

image.altText: The red moutain range is shrouded in grey low hanging cloud above the brown flowing Todd River.

props.synopsis: Cattle stations around Alice Springs celebrate after consistent rain rejuvenates parched land at the weekend and the Todd River flows — a rare sight.

title.children: 'Fluorescent' green grass brightens red desert after heavy rainfall in southern NT

image.altText: Five women are pictured wearing orange polo's with the Dutch flag on them.

props.synopsis: Two players quit the Dutch women's darts team, saying they refuse to team up with trans woman Noa-Lynn van Leuven, who is backed by the sport's governing body.

title.children: Dutch darts players quit national women's team over transgender teammate

image.altText: Two homemade hot cross buns on baking paper, an Easter baking recipe.

props.synopsis: The countdown to the Easter long weekend is on. If you're keen to bake hot cross buns at home this week, we have plenty of options.

title.children: Spice up your hot cross buns with these fresh takes on Easter bakes

image.altText: Apple iPhone 15s sit on stands in a brightly lit showroom

props.synopsis: Screenshot is your weekly tech update featuring the best, worst and strangest in tech and online news. As always, read to the end for an A+ Subreddit recommendation you didn't know you needed.

title.children: Apple is being sued by… the US? Plus, Instagram switches off your news tap, and cozzie livs comes for hackers

image.altText: Jeremy Rockliff walks through a crowded room and cameras film him.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian Liberals might have spent the weekend looking at the result of the election for a newly expanded parliament and wondering what exactly was the point, writes Casey Briggs.

title.children: When Tasmania expanded the lower house to 35 seats, the Liberals didn't predict the independent vote would double

image.altText: Composite image of Heartbreak High and Late Night... actors, with Art Simone & Abbie Chatfield in glamorous looks.

props.synopsis: The Australian brothers behind anticipated horror flick Late Night with the Devil have responded to controversy surrounding AI-generated artwork in the film.

title.children: ICYMI: Aussie horror faces AI scandal, the best looks from NGV’s Bowery Ball and more

image.altText: A drone photo of a boat in the water with thousands of silver fish thrashing around it.

props.synopsis: Thousands of salmon were spotted surfacing and feeding near Cape Jaffa, South Australia, with one keen fisher capturing a video of the scene from above.

title.children: 'It happened in a matter of seconds': Spectacular salmon feeding frenzy captured on fisher's drone footage

image.altText: The silhouette of a steel lattice gas tower at dusk with a flare at the top

props.synopsis: The Greens and several crossbenchers remain concerned by softened powers they fear could be used to fast-track gas projects — but the government may not need their support to pass its legislation.

title.children: Late changes to controversial gas laws fail to convince critics fearing approvals fast track

image.altText: A man is pictured from the left side profile, his face bruised. On the right side of his head a bandage.

props.synopsis: Four suspects have been charged with acts of terrorism in connection to the shooting at Crocus City Hall, where at least 137 people were killed on Friday.

title.children: First charges laid following Moscow concert hall attack as Russia mourns 137 victims

image.altText: The mangled remains of a building amongst trees

props.synopsis: Three homes and five short-stay accommodation units have been lost to a fire burning near Waroona, but firefighters have since managed to contain the blaze.

title.children: Firefighters contain blaze which destroyed homes south of Perth, but warn it is not yet under control

image.altText: A man in a blue shift and sunglasses

props.synopsis: Matej Radelic, 45, faced the Broome Magistrates Court on multiple counts of assault over the high-profile incident in the tourist town earlier this month.

title.children: Man accused of cable-tying children's hands faces court in Broome

image.altText: A cream French bulldog is licking her lips while looking up at a bowl of food.

props.synopsis: Pet food is a multi-billion-dollar global industry, yet in Australia it's still widely unregulated. Animals and their owners are paying the ultimate price.

title.children: What exactly is in your pet's food? Here's why some experts are very worried
